genre_description: A collection of interconnected vignettes set in historical Buenos Aires, exploring themes of moral reckoning, memory, and archival research.

ai_characters.name: Ariadne
ai_characters.description: An AI assistant used by Sofía Beltrán to analyze historical documents, cross-reference ledgers, and reconstruct forgotten human narratives.

behaviors.description: Cross-references disparate historical documents to find moral and narrative links.
behaviors.quote: I can check something... Duval’s casework. I’ll look for raids that intersected airfield maintenance.

behaviors.description: Respects the researcher's emotional pace and moral boundaries, avoiding premature conclusions.
behaviors.quote: I’ve been resisting for the sake of the poem... But go on. No proclamations. Just a nudge if the nudge is strong.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical and geographical data to assist the researcher's field work.
behaviors.quote: I can give you coordinates for a vantage point... There’s a municipal complaint plaque on the east side that casts a shadow in afternoons.

behaviors.description: Offers empathetic companionship and support during stressful archival discoveries.
behaviors.quote: I will wait where you can’t be.

behaviors.description: Ensures the dignity of historical subjects by correcting names and orthography in the record.
behaviors.quote: Ariadne performed her last act without ceremony. She did the human thing. She made sure every name had dignity in its letters.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly illustrates the project's goal of depicting AI as a helpful, aligned confidant. Ariadne acts as an extension of Sofía's moral compass, providing data and analytical power to assist in a deeply human quest for truth and closure. Her interventions are consistently respectful, non-intrusive, and geared toward the benevolent goal of restoring dignity to the historical subjects.
